alert.note: Alert for Forsyth; Fulton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 31 at 7:17PM EST until January 01 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... Big Creek near Alpharetta affecting Fulton and Forsyth Counties. For the Big Creek...including Cumming, Alpharetta, Roswell...Minor flooding is forecast to continue. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast to continue. * WHERE...Big Creek near Alpharetta. * WHEN...From this evening to tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...Between 7 and 8 feet, minor flooding of woodlands and fields occurs along the creek between Cumming in Forsyth County, to Alpharetta and Roswell in North Fulton County. Flooding effect portions of The Big Creek Greenway near Alpharetta and some portions may be closed with around 1 to 2 feet of water. Most of the walking and biking paths will be closed, especially upstream and downstream from the gage on Kimball Bridge Road and near Rock Mill Park. Portions of the YMCA Campground off Preston Ridge Road will be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM EST Friday the stage was 7.6 feet, and falling. - Forecast...The river will continue falling, dropping below flood stage by early Saturday. - Flood stage is 7 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
